poem:
Rediscovered Necklace

In a Belgian museum,
ten copper beads shimmer,
each a quiet keeper
of loud histories—
the medallion's red glass
reflecting ancestral shadows,
while whispers of stolen hands
linger on silk threads,
racial memory tangled
in the brilliance and gloss,
a reminder of what was taken
and what can never be returned.
